description:
Nipe Story (Tell Me A Story)  is a fortnightly Kenyan podcast that gives a voice to written short stories.  This podcast is hosted by Kevin Mwachiro. @kevmwachiro
Karibu! Welcome.

items.content: A flight from Cape Town to Dublin disappears somewhere over Zimbabwe. On it are two passengers trying to connect with their respective pasts.  One is hoping for love while the other is hoping for home.
items.contentSnippet: A flight from Cape Town to Dublin disappears somewhere over Zimbabwe. On it are two passengers trying to connect with their respective pasts.  One is hoping for love while the other is hoping for home.

items.title: On A String and A Prayer by Mabel Mnensa

items.content: Love doesn't always come easy, and when it does come you have to fight for it to make sure you don't lose it.   Though one thing is for sure, love wins.
items.contentSnippet: Love doesn't always come easy, and when it does come you have to fight for it to make sure you don't lose it.   Though one thing is for sure, love wins.

items.title: STORMS WE'VE WEATHERED by Brian Muchiri

items.content: When a rite of passage gets you thinking about who you are and also makes you question adulting.
items.contentSnippet: When a rite of passage gets you thinking about who you are and also makes you question adulting.

items.title: RE-IMAGINING FREEDOM by Mwangi Mwaura

items.content: A surreal tale from Zimbabwe that makes you realise that only once you are on the other side do you get a much better view of life.
items.contentSnippet: A surreal tale from Zimbabwe that makes you realise that only once you are on the other side do you get a much better view of life.

items.title: MISSING by Isabella Matambanadzo

items.content: Adanna Okoro is her name, she is a beautiful woman with a past. A past that is tied to a family tragedy that changed her home. And yet there is her own story, one she cannot share publicly. And then there is Okechukwu, our eyes into Adanna, the Okoros and life and how it can change unexpectedly.

items.title: KHAKI by David Nnana Ikpo

items.content: Louis Njoroge has his intentions in the right place, but sadly he is surrounded by colleagues who have no intention of doing right.
